snippet: The Comedy Awards, on Comedy Central, are more irreverent than most awards shows, but tastefulness still interferes.
abstract: Jason Zinoman observes that the Comedy Awards show on Comedy Central is more irreverent and entertaining to watch than most award shows, but its attempt at tastefulness prevents it from being truly exciting. Photo (M)t
lead_paragraph: We need irreverent comedians more than ever these days, because without them, how could we possibly sit through all those tedious award shows? No one is better at interrupting industry back-patting to deliver a smack to the head than Chris Rock, who at the Tonys ceremony last year called his announcement of the award for best musical as pointless as ''taking a hooker to dinner.'' Opening the second-annual Comedy Awards, recorded last Saturday and being shown on Sunday night on Comedy Central, he was more blunt. Of the eligible comics for best comedy special, he said, three are funny, one used to be and another never was. Then he assured the audience he was not joking. Then he took it back.

headline.main: Finding the Humor in Giving Out Comedy Awards
